strings.Value: "You and your band had best leave while you still can."
[Lie] "This is all a big misunderstanding. You seem to have confused me with someone else. Trust me, I've never heard about you before. I'm just passing through these lands!"
"Who are you and what do you want from me?"
"Ah, yes. That was a great hunt. Your friends made for fine game. Have you come to share in their fate?"
"Is this any reason for us to quarrel? It was just a joke!"
"There is no excuse for my actions. Let me redeem myself."
"My behavior was unacceptable. My sincere apologies."
[Give 1000 gold] "Let me pay."
"Bring out your beast."
[Give 3000 gold] "Give this money to the families of the deceased."
"You are right. I am ready to accept my punishment."

"Hey, you there!" {n}Armed men dressed in wandering clothes are looking at you.The look upon their faces, as well as the tone of their female leader's voice, do not bode well.{/n} "Yes, you! Jamel Visser sends his regards."
{n}The huntress gives you a wicked smile.{/n}

"Jamel asked me to tell you — we are not murderers, judges, nor executioners. We are hunters. You will be judged by the forest, just as we are. Earn your right to live!"
{n}The hunters vanish back into the foliage. With a thundering roar, a hulking beast emerges from the trees.{/n}
"Have you already forgotten about us? We remember you well. We are the {g|Embeth Travelers}hunters of the Embeth Forest{/g}. Do you recall the {d|c22 safari unfair}beast hunt{/d}?"

{n}The righteous indignation on the huntress' face gives way to embarassment. As she whispers something to one of her companions, he shrugs.{/n} "Hm... I am sorry, there was a mistake. You shouldn't loiter around here. The ruler of these lands is a true gorgon if I ever saw one."
{n}The huntress gives you a sideways grin.{/n} "Save your breath. It is not us you shall be speaking to."
"A joke?!" {n}The huntress' face is twisted with rage.{/n} "Those people had families! They came to aid you, and you killed them... For what? To win a prize? Is that what you call joke?"
"A joke, you say?" {n}The huntress grins.{/n} "Well, now it's our turn to play a joke on you. You've taken the prize — now you have to earn it!"
{n}The huntress clenches her teeth, her gaze full of hate. She spits on the ground, then gives a cold smile.{/n} "Now it's your turn to be the game!"

{n}The huntress frowns, evaluating your answer, then after a long moment, speaks.{/n} "Apologies alone are not enough. Pay for that which you have taken from us... or prove that you are indeed worthy of such a reward — in battle with a beast."
{n}The huntress smirks.{/n} "You won't get off so easily — apologies are not enough. I hope that our prize was to your liking. Now comes the time to earn it!"

{n}The huntress frowns, evaluating your answer, then after a long moment, speaks.{/n}
"Those people had families. Children. What good are your apologies to them?"
"Those people came to your aid — in return you slaughtered them for some measly prize! And now you dare beg for forgiveness? You shall redeem yourself once you're dead!"
{n}The huntress takes the money and nods.{/n} "The matter is closed. I shall pass this on to Jamel along with your apologies."
"Good. Show us what you're made of."
"Hm!" {n}The huntress is surprised by the sum.{/n} "All the coin in {g|Golarion}Golarion{/g} wouldn't make up for their lives, but... have it your way. I shall give them the gold and your apologies."
{n}The hunters take a step back and vanish from sight, disappearing into the forest.{/n}
"I do not believe that people like you can ever repent. I may be wrong. If you survive this battle, we shall see your next move."
"You took that which you had not earned. We've come to give you a chance to prove yourself deserving of the prize."

"You slaughtered those who came to your aid. If it were up to me, I would have slit your throat in your sleep... however, even though you had no mercy for your victims, Jamel insisted we give you a chance."
"Well said."
